```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
require(dplyr)
require(ggplot2)
require(lubridate)
require(stringr)
```


Read in data:
```{r data-load}
link = "https://www.michigan.gov/documents/coronavirus/Cases_and_Deaths_by_County_and_by_Date_of_Symptom_Onset_or_by_Date_of_Death2020-11-14_707797_7.xlsx"
download.file(link, destfile = "/tmp/file.xlsx")

mi_data = readxl::read_excel("/tmp/file.xlsx")

head(mi_data)
```

Wrangle Data:
```{r data-wrangling, warning=FALSE}
mi_cases_by_day = mi_data %>% 
  # filter(COUNTY == "Kent") %>%
  group_by(Date) %>%
  mutate(
    Cases = sum(Cases),
    Date = date(Date)
  ) 

# linkdate <- as.Date(strsplit(link, "_")[[1]][16])
# linkandnowdiff <- day(now()) - day(linkdate)

day_split = 5

mi_cases_by_day_exclusive <- mi_cases_by_day %>%
  filter(                                   #most recent data is often inaccurate and revised
    Date < date(now()) - day_split + 1,
  )

mi_cases_by_day_last4 <- mi_cases_by_day %>%
  filter(                         
    Date >= date(now()) - day_split + 1,
  )
```

Visualization:
```{r viz}
mi_cases_by_day_exclusive %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = Date, y = Cases)) +
  ylim(c(0,NA)) +
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "gam") +
  geom_point(
    data = mi_cases_by_day_last4,
    mapping = aes(x = Date, y = Cases, color = "red"),
  ) +
  scale_x_date(date_labels = "%m-%d",
               date_breaks = "2 weeks") + 
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  labs(title = "Michigan Coronavirus Cases")
```

Note that the last `r length(unique(mi_cases_by_day_last4$Date))` days of data have been colored red on the graph, as they frequently change as more information becomes available.
